summary: This is an affidavit from a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, submitted in a civil case involving Alan Dershowitz. The affiant, who worked for Epstein from 1991 to 2002, provides testimony about the nature of massages at Epstein's Palm Beach home, his interactions with Alan Dershowitz, and corrects alleged misrepresentations of his prior statements made by attorneys Bradley Edwards and Paul Cassell.

persons.name: Alan M. Dershowitz
persons.context: A famous lawyer and defendant in the case. The affiant states Dershowitz visited Epstein's Palm Beach home 4-5 times a year for social/professional gatherings and received at least one massage from an adult masseuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The affiant's former employer from 1991-2002. The affidavit discusses the operations of his Palm Beach home, including massages for guests.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: An attorney who, along with Paul Cassell, is alleged by the affiant to have misrepresented his prior statements in legal filings.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: An attorney who, along with Bradley Edwards, is alleged by the affiant to have misrepresented his prior statements in legal filings.

persons.name: Ms. Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to in the context of her bathroom in Epstein's private suite, where the affiant occasionally found vibrators and sex toys after massages.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Listed by the affiant as one of the celebrities seen at Epstein's home during his employment.

persons.name: President Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the affiant met at Epstein's plane during the last month of his employment.

persons.name: Princess Sarah Ferguson
persons.context: Listed by the affiant as one of the celebrities seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Mr. Trump
persons.context: Listed by the affiant as one of the celebrities seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Robert Kennedy, Jr.
persons.context: Listed by the affiant as one of the celebrities seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the attorney for 'Jane Doe 102' asked the affiant about.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the attorney for 'Jane Doe 102' asked the affiant about.

persons.name: Daniel Estes
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the attorney for 'Jane Doe 102' asked the affiant about.

persons.context: Mentioned as someone the attorney for 'Jane Doe 102' asked the affiant about.

persons.context: Mentioned as someone the attorney for 'Jane Doe 102' asked the affiant about.

persons.name: Senator Mitchell
persons.context: Listed by the affiant as one of the celebrities seen at Epstein's home.

connections.description: Dershowitz was a guest at Epstein's Palm Beach home approximately 4-5 times a year for social/professional gatherings.
Dershowitz visited the home where Maxwell had a private bathroom, but the affiant clarifies Dershowitz did not receive massages in the private suite containing Maxwell's items.
Attorneys who filed papers together that the affiant claims misrepresent his prior statements.
Prince Andrew is listed among the celebrities who visited Epstein's home.
The affiant met President Clinton at Epstein's plane.

events.title: Affiant's Deposition in Jane Doe No. 2 v. Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The affiant gave a deposition in a civil case against Jeffrey Epstein, where he answered questions about his time working for Epstein.

events.title: Sworn Statement to Palm Beach Police
events.description: The affiant gave a sworn statement to detectives during the Palm Beach Police Department's investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Misrepresentation by Edwards and Cassell
events.description: Attorneys Bradley Edwards and Paul Cassell filed a paper containing a statement about Dershowitz and massages that the affiant claims is inaccurate.

events.title: Second Alleged Misrepresentation by Edwards and Cassell
events.description: Attorneys Bradley Edwards and Paul Cassell filed another paper containing a statement about a photograph that the affiant claims is a misrepresentation.

events.title: Affidavit Submission
events.description: The affiant signs and dates this affidavit to correct the record regarding his prior statements about Alan Dershowitz and Jeffrey Epstein's home.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: The affiant worked for Jeffrey Epstein from 1991 to 2002 as a maintenance worker and home manager at the Palm Beach residence.
The affiant states that Alan Dershowitz visited Epstein's home 4-5 times a year, received at least one massage from an adult masseuse, and was never seen doing anything improper.
The affiant claims attorneys Bradley Edwards and Paul Cassell misrepresented his prior deposition testimony in their legal filings regarding Dershowitz and massages.
The affidavit describes a system of 50-100 masseuses (mostly women, some men) providing massages to Epstein and his guests, with sex toys found only in Epstein's private suite/Maxwell's bathroom.
The affiant lists numerous high-profile visitors to Epstein's home, including Prince Andrew, President Clinton, Donald Trump, and Robert Kennedy Jr.
